intro: Aphelandra pectinata, commonly known as the golden waxplant, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, waxy, yellow-green leaves and clusters of fragrant, white to yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and thrives in humid, warm environments. Its foliage is often used in ornamental horticulture for its aesthetic appeal. Aphelandra pectinata prefers partial shade and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor and outdoor gardens.
